item.description: Frank Harrell teaches an amazing course ‚ÄúRegression Modeling Strategies‚Äù based on his book each spring at Vanderbilt. This was one of my all time favorite courses. item.title: Wait, what are P-values?
item.description: Frequently, and especially recently, misunderstandings of common statistical terms/ concepts have caused confusion and even anger. I would like to (attempt) to clear up a big player in the world of commonly used (and commonly misunderstood) statistical concepts: the p-value. Stealing Lucy D‚ÄôAgostino McGowan‚Äôs XKCD embedding strategy. TL DR A p-value is not a probability of the true parameter being something, but the percentage of times that the data you saw, or more extreme data, would occur given some ‚Äúnull‚Äù model.
